member_organisations: Members are individuals, not organisations. Members are the general counsel or company secretary (or equivilent) working in FTSE 100 (or former FTSE 100) companies.
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Competition, Consumers, Employment and Social Affairs, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Climate Action, Banking and financial services
head_office_address: C/O Thomson Reuters Legal UK & Ireland, 5 Canada Square Canary Wharf
eu_initiatives: Responding to consultations and initiatives on proposed regulations and legislative initiatives that would impact on UK FTSE 100 Companies in areas such as corporate governance, capital markets, fnancial reporting, competition, employment, data protection and consumer law
organisation_name: The Association of General Counsel and Company Secretaries working in FTSE 100 Companies (GC100)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: GC100 is not a member of any associations/networks or other bodies. Individual  members may belong personally or through their employer to other associations.
goals__remit:
The objects of the Group are to: 
2.1.1 provide a collective voice and, as appropriate, make representations on areas of policy, regulatory and legislative reform that impact on large companies that are listed in the United Kingdom; 
2.1.2 enable members to share knowledge and information on the law, company secretarial practice, risk management, compliance, governance, pro bono work and other areas of common interest; and 
2.1.3 assist members and potential future members in their professional development.
